availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, preacher and brick layer. Sallisboro, Lewis County, Kentucky native. Married America Vickers on October 11, 1841. Father of William T. Jolly, John Jolly, James Jolly, and Edward Jolly. Baptist preacher and circuit preacher in 1842. Served as the minister to Flagg Springs Baptist Church in Campbell County in April 1849. Brick Layer in Campbell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, p. 799.
Find A Grave, "Rev. J. M. Jolly (December 13, 1817-September 25, 1900)," Memorial #66362107, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66362107 (accessed April 13, 2019).
Jack Wessling, "Jolly, James Monroe" in The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 495-496.
